I had this happen to me in Skyrim, when i, a level 50 Dragonborn with full daedric armor decided to take on a shirtless orc in a cave. I set him on fire and hit him twice with a daedric greatsword, and this did nothing to his health at all.
He then preceeded to turn around and kill me in two hits with his iron sword.
Tbh, now that you ask, i can't really remember what pissed me off about him back when i played the first game, but when it came to that mission, i do remember not caring at all that he died.

I still think Assassin's creed 1 had the best cities, mainly because there were so many people walking around and talking, and the market vendors advertising their stuff, really made it feel like a real city. The next couple of games, while being vastly superior in everything else, kind of lost this.
Also, what's up with everything being so damn sparkly in Assassin's Creed 2?
I feel like they sacrificed a lot of Hitman-like design so that they could have a bigger focus on story, which would have been alright, if the story wasn't a PILE OF SHIT
